Name: Seated Harpocrates
Description: This small bronze has been found in the T temple at Kawa, a town to the south of the 3rd cataract. It depicts the infant-god Harpocrates sitting, his two arms alongside the body. The shaved head bears a uraeus on the brow and a twisted lock hanging on the side. The piece probably dates from the reign of Taharqa, sixth king of the 25th Dynasty.
